review: I own several different solutions to solve the problem of getting content onto my TV.  I have the Amazon Fire Stick.  I have a Roku 3.  AppleTV.  Even one of my TV's can do it without any additional gear.  The ChromeCast is elegantly simple, but perhaps too limited compared to the others.  It basically provides a wireless bridge between your phone (or computer) and the TV to display whatever content you have.  It doesn't provide access to any content on its own.  For the money, the Roku provides much more functionality.  Still, the ChromeCast is very well executed and does a great job within its design parameters.  Yes, you need to provide separate power to the unit, which means an extra cable coming from somewhere.  If your TV provides power via USB you could power it from one of those slots.  Otherwise, you're running a cable to the wall adapter.
author: Evan Jacobs

review: We purchased the chrome cast and enjoyed it for about 6 months. We did have an issue with an update and having to reboot our router and the chrome cast. However, today we went to cast and it won't cast at all. We did a hard reset and everything. It has completely stopped working!!! Apparently this is a problem that Google knows about and has no way of fixing and has even ignored customers asking how to fix it.
